title: Can you skew the odds for champion shards towards champions with unused Mastery Tokens?
body:
This is what my tokens tab looks like:
https://i.imgur.com/vxp8omM.png

This is what my shards tab looks like:
https://i.imgur.com/VZMTUdL.png

I'm not asking to be guaranteed a shard for the token champs, because that would be a little too convenient.  I've never disenchanted a champ shard since the new system came out, and the odds of getting the shards for any of these mastery token champs looks super low with how biased the system feels against getting a 4800/6300.  I feel like some weight should be added towards the side of champs with mastery tokens.

> [{quoted}](name=Mysticman89,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E2byBYW1,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-01-03T03:18:52.038+0000)
>
> I don't think it'd be wise to be able to influence drops like that, otherwise the optimisation would be to stock up 6300 mastery tokens and avoid the rest.

It could be limited to 2 champ shards per champion.  You don't need more than that to get to mastery 7.  And it wouldn't be a guaranteed drop.  It would just be a slight quality of life change.  I haven't gotten a single shard for a 4800+ champ that I have mastery tokens for, and I'm level 53 now.

The reverse issue is also a thing though, where people would be incentivized to *not* get mastery tokens for cheap champions.

Theres also a sizable fraction of the player base who would much prefer shard drops for champions they *don't* own for the juicy BE discount, so any sort of biasing towards mastery tokens (which implies the champ is owned) would be counter productive to that.

It's most likely fairest if it's uniformly random. There will be some people who are 'unlucky' and will be grumbly about it, but since what 'unlucky' even means isn't the same for every player it's quite difficult to justify any sort of biasing.
